game

Class MazeData

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.MazeData

  • public class MazeData
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a maze, with many common methods that you could do with a maze.
    Author:
    Dhruv Lohani

    • Field Summary

      Represents the size of the maze

      • draw

        public void draw(processing.core.PApplet marker,
                 float x,
                 float y,
                 float w,
                 float h)
        Draws the maze on the PApplet
        Parameters:
        marker - the marker where the PApplet is draw
        x - the upper x coord of the maze
        y - the upper y coord of the maze
        w - the width of the maze
        h - the height of the maze

      • toStringArr

        public java.lang.String[][] toStringArr()
        This method converts the maze into a array of strings in order to successfully display on console.
        Returns:
        A string array representing the maze with the characters "+" representing a corner, a "-" representing a wall and a " " representing an empty location.

      • convertToPoint

        public static java.awt.Point convertToPoint(float x1,
                                            float y1,
                                            float x,
                                            float y,
                                            float w,
                                            float h,
                                            char[][] grid,
                                            boolean isActor,
                                            double vx,
                                            double vy)
        Converts a grid pixel coordinate to a point on the grid of the maze
        Parameters:
        x1 - the grid pixel x1 coordinate
        y1 - the grid pixel y1 coordinate
        x - the upper left x coordinate of the maze
        y - the upper left y coordinate of the maze
        w - the width of the maze
        h - the height of the maze
        grid - the grid which represents the character by character grid of the maze
        isActor - used to determine if the object is an actor
        vx - the velocity on the x of the actor, if it is an actor
        vy - the velocity on the y of the actor, if it is an actor
        Returns:

      • toIntArray

        public int[][] toIntArray()

      • isActorTouchingMaze

        public static boolean[] isActorTouchingMaze(java.util.ArrayList<Rectangle> walls,
                                            Actor a)
        Parameters:
        walls - which represents the walls in the maze
        a - which represents actor(or specifically protaganist in the maze
        Returns:
        a boolean array of length 4 which is: Position 0 of the array represents whether the actor is touching the wall from left. Position 1 of the array represents whether the actor is touching the wall from the right. Position 2 of the array represents whether the actor is touching the wall from the top Position 3 of the array represents whether the actor is touching the wall from the bottom.
